intro: Picrorhiza lindleyana, commonly known as Indian picrolith, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Labiatae and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers and is often found in rocky, alpine environments. Its roots are the primary part used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic properties. The botanical features of Picrorhiza lindleyana make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
